formula: G.f.: (Sum_{k>=0} x^(3^k)/(1+x^(3^k)+x^(2*3^k)))/(1-x). In general, the generating function for the number of digits equal to d in the base b representation of n (0 < d < b) is (Sum_{k>=0} x^(d*b^k)/(Sum_{i=0..b-1} x^(i*b^k)))/(1-x). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 03 2005 [For d=0, use the above formula with d=b: (Sum_{k>=0} x^(b^(k+1))/(Sum_{i=0..b-1} x^(i*b^k)))/(1-x), adding 1 if you consider the representation of 0 to have one zero digit.]
a(n) = a(floor(n/3)) + (n mod 3) mod 2. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 24 2006
program: a062756 n = a062756 n' + m `mod` 2 where (n',m) = divMod n 3
